name: Hello World
description: Simple greeting script demonstrating parameter extraction and basic script structure. Perfect starting point for learning Auto Responder scripting.
author: MeshMonitor

name: System Info
description: Shell script example showing system uptime and node information. Demonstrates shell scripting with Auto Responder.
author: MeshMonitor

name: Weather Template
description: Python weather script template with error handling. Shows stub implementation ready for your API integration.
author: MeshMonitor

name: Multi-Message Demo (JavaScript)
description: Demonstrates returning multiple responses that are queued and sent sequentially with rate limiting. JavaScript implementation.
author: MeshMonitor

name: Multi-Message Demo (Python)
description: Demonstrates returning multiple responses that are queued and sent sequentially with rate limiting. Python implementation.
author: MeshMonitor

name: Multi-Message Demo (Shell)
description: Demonstrates returning multiple responses that are queued and sent sequentially with rate limiting. Shell implementation.
author: MeshMonitor

name: Battery Status Monitor
description: Reports battery status for a configured list of nodes. Queries the database directly for battery level, voltage, and last heard time. Edit the script to configure which nodes to monitor.
author: MeshMonitor

name: Weather Bot
description: Get weather information for any location using Pirate Weather API with OpenStreetMap geocoding. Supports any location format (city, zip, address, etc.) with multi-pattern trigger support.
requirements: PIRATE_WEATHER_API_KEY environment variable (get free key from https://pirateweather.net/)
author: Codename-11

name: AI Assistant
description: AI-powered assistant supporting local Ollama (offline) and cloud APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic). Features automatic fallback between providers and multi-pattern trigger support.
author: Codename-11

name: Sunrise/Sunset Calculator
description: Calculate sunrise, sunset, and daylight times for any location using free APIs. Features automatic timezone detection and local time formatting with multi-pattern trigger support.
requirements: No API keys required (uses free services)
author: Codename-11
features: Free sunrise-sunset.org API (no API key required)

name: Fun Bot
description: Entertainment bot providing trivia, facts, jokes, and quotes - all content stored locally. Features daily variety (seeded by date) and mesh/radio/tech themed content.
requirements: No external dependencies or API keys required
author: Codename-11

name: Commands Directory
description: Lists all available Auto Responder commands/triggers configured in your MeshMonitor instance. Features dynamic command listing and multi-message support for long lists.
requirements: No external dependencies or API keys required
author: Codename-11
features: Easy to update when adding new scripts

name: MM-Weather
description: Weather bot that uses nodes lat/long to pull current data from api.weather.gov. Falls back to local instance GPS info if none was provided by the requesting node.
author: Yoss101
features: Uses node's GPS coordinates for location
Falls back to local instance GPS if node has none
Powered by api.weather.gov (US National Weather Service)

name: MeshManager Solar Forecast
description: Query MeshManager's solar forecast API and return an abbreviated summary with today's solar production forecast, percentage of historical average, and nodes at risk of low battery.
author: Yeraze
features: Identifies nodes at risk of low battery

name: Radio Identity + QTH
description: Register radio identities (Ham callsign, GMRS callsign/unit, CB handle, or Club alias) and request on-demand QTH responses with Maidenhead grid and optional distance/bearing to MeshMonitor station.
author: maxhayim
features: Register Ham, GMRS, CB, or Club identities
QTH response with Maidenhead grid locator
Distance and bearing to MeshMonitor station

name: WX (Weather Alerts)
description: Automatically broadcasts NOAA/NWS weather alerts for a configured location using Timer Triggers. Posts bulletins for NEW, UPDATED, and CLEARED alerts with smart deduplication to prevent mesh spam. Supports on-demand commands for weather summaries and detailed alert info.
author: maxhayim

name: Carrier Outage Monitor
description: Monitors health of mobile carriers, ISPs, and cloud/CDN/DNS infrastructure. Uses conservative detection logic with confidence scoring to identify provider-level outages while avoiding false positives.
requirements: Optional: mqtt package for MQTT publishing
author: maxhayim
features: Conservative detection with control probe validation
Customizable provider lists via JSON config

name: Sky and Sea Alert
description: A script that delivers simple, emoji-based alerts when aircraft fly overhead or vessels pass nearby, using local ADS-B/AIS receivers or official cloud APIs.
requirements: ADSBX_API_KEY environment variable (free from ADS-B Exchange)
AISHUB_API_KEY environment variable (free from AIS Hub)
author: maxhayim
features: Aircraft overhead alerts via ADS-B Exchange API
Vessel proximity alerts via AIS Hub API
No external Python dependencies (uses only requests)

name: Remote Admin (Python)
description: Send remote admin commands to Meshtastic nodes via the CLI. Designed for Geofence triggers but works with any automation. Supports rebooting nodes, changing settings, and more when nodes enter/exit geofences.
author: MeshMonitor
features: Use with Geofence triggers for location-based actions
Uses MESHTASTIC_IP and NODE_ID environment variables
Create wrapper scripts for specific geofence actions
JSON output for integration with MeshMonitor

name: Remote Admin (Shell)
description: Simple shell wrapper for remote admin commands. Pass any meshtastic CLI arguments to control nodes when they enter/exit geofences.
author: MeshMonitor
features: Pass arguments directly to meshtastic CLI
Uses MESHTASTIC_IP and NODE_ID environment variables
Easy to create wrapper scripts for specific actions
JSON output for integration with MeshMonitor

name: MeMon - Network Health Monitor
description: Monitors router and DNS resolver health with intelligent alerting. Supports Auto Responder (on-demand status checks) and Timer Trigger (scheduled monitoring with failure streak tracking, alert backoff, and recovery detection). Prevents alert spam through configurable thresholds.
exampleTrigger: netcheck status, netcheck router, netcheck dns
requirements: Python 3.5+ (standard library only, zero external dependencies)
memon.config.json configuration file (see README for examples)
author: DagBertelsen
features: Router health checks (HTTPS, HTTP, or TCP socket)
DNS resolver monitoring with multiple servers
Failure streak tracking with alert backoff
Dual mode: Auto Responder (stateless) or Timer Trigger (stateful)

name: EQ (Earthquake Alerts)
description: Automatically broadcasts USGS earthquake alerts for a configured location using Timer Triggers. Posts bulletins for NEW, UPDATED, and CLEARED alerts with smart deduplication to prevent mesh spam. Supports on-demand commands for earthquake summaries and detailed event info.
author: jeepnjonny
features: Configurable radius, magnitude threshold, and lookback window

name: LLM Bridge
description: Interact with Large Language Models (OpenAI-compatible APIs, OpenClaw, Ollama, etc.) over Meshtastic. Enforces strict Meshtastic-safe response limits and automatically splits long answers to remain within radio constraints.
requirements: Configured LLM endpoint (OpenAI-compatible API or Ollama)
author: maxhayim
features: Supports OpenAI-compatible APIs, OpenClaw, and Ollama
Automatic response splitting for Meshtastic radio limits
HTTP retry logic with configurable timeout
Environment variable configuration for all settings

name: RayHunter Monitor
description: Monitors an EFF RayHunter device for IMSI catcher / cell-site simulator warnings and broadcasts alerts on the mesh. Polls the current analysis for Low, Medium, and High severity events and formats a concise alert message.
requirements: Python 3.8+ (standard library only, zero external dependencies)
EFF RayHunter device on the network (default http://192.168.1.1:8080)
author: MeshMonitor
features: Polls RayHunter current recording for active warnings
Parses NDJSON analysis reports for Low/Medium/High severity events
Formatted mesh-friendly alert messages with severity counts
Silent when no warnings (no unnecessary mesh traffic)
Configurable RayHunter URL via --url flag or RAYHUNTER_URL env var
